comment: This might be the first engineering class I ever fail. He won't release grades and told us if we don't fill out the survey he won't let us know until final grades are due. Very harsh grader and curves upwards of 25% on exams bc no one can get high enough grades on them. Exams aren't returned either, so you don't know what to improve.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment:
Dropped the class. Amount of required homework and assignment was insane. At the end of the semester a lot of people failed, he is also withholding final grades until more people fill out his course evaluations. He had a mandatory test due on a national holiday. You have to type a few paragraphs summarizing each lecture.

DO NOT TAKE!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: I want to say that Prof. Veazie seems like a kind individual, but he seems to have developed a power complex surrounding himself. You have to take tests when he says without question or he will fail you. I had a family emergency and was told there are no exceptions. Instruction is vague and there are no detailed explanations of what you did wrong.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He actively threatened students over finding grading mistakes in his tests. He straight victimized students that asked questions, but wanted to get in class participation.He got madder when people didn't speak up.He doesn't want you here, he actively hates you.He is the most unhinged professor I have ever had.I would transfer I ever take him again.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He's a good talker, but not a good teacher. He seems like a cool guy, but you don't learn much from him. His formula sheets are overcrowded with no context. The only real good thing about him as a teacher is he curves the 3 tests very well (our first one he curved 25 points). Your grade is test heavy, but also includes attendance and homework.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Big curves but at what cost. Too many examples of his issues to list here, but a quick search on the KSU subreddit is pretty revealing. Pop quizes are weighted as tests, with zero (and I do mean LITERALLY zero) excuses for missing one. Is the textbook right, his lecture right, or his PPT right? Who knows, but they often all contradict each other.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: Obviously a pretty lazy teacher. Reads off of Powerpoints created from however many year ago and usually has some content missing or not fully explained. Doesn't go over enough problems and the textbook problems for homework can't be worked out using the material covered in class. Gives a generous curve on his test because most people wouldnt pass.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Homework is solved with methods not covered in class usually. Provides a mostly useless formula sheet but swears it has everything. Lecture is just him reading off of a PowerPoint that is 90% text and not working out any examples. Asking questions doesn't get you much. He does curve, but I can't imagine he'd have many passing students if he didn't.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Probably one of the worst professors I have ever had. The exams were absolutely insane and did not relate fully to the hw. Although the test were heavy, he did give a curve, but even then, the test were super complicate that some people were not able to finish under the 1:30 time given for the exam and still failed.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: The pumpkin launch he does sounds good on paper, but it's being done with freshman like me that have never done this before. It doesn't help that he is incredibly demanding while not getting involved at all. The project was a nightmare to manage and nearly cost me a scholarship. He's not a good guy, far from it, and he's a bad teacher, avoid him.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment:
Dr. Veazie brings a wealth of knowledge to the subject matter. Also announces career-building extra-curricular opportunities to his students in class. His course prepared me well for future endeavors.

The slideshows are accessible online, but attendance matters, and he seems appreciative of those attending.

The difficulty is similar to PHYS 2212.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Hilarious--Respected

comment: Professor isn't that great at explaining the concepts he assigns homework on, and the few in-class examples he does provide aren't that great when compared to the homework. Overall class isn't too bad, but I would avoid this professor if I had to take this class again. Don't skip class as you will lose a lot of participation points for it.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: TAKE HIM! Such an amazing professor. He's in charge of the pumpkin launch and is very hands-off when it comes to giving instructions so you'll have to figure it out on your own but trust me that is exactly what you need for his class to get an A. Attendance is mandatory so don't miss class and hw is 10 min per week, easy stuff.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Amazing lectures

comment: I know there's a lot of negative about Veazie, but honestly if you actually apply yourself and you display to him that you're actually trying to improve test to test, this class simplifies. Machine design is a tough course no matter who you take. If you're struggling take advantage of his office hours he shows a lot of tough love but it's worth it.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Respected

comment: Best professor!!!  very organized, understanding, and funny Professor. Yes,  attendance is requested. But that is the key to get an A. 100% attend his class every once a week with absolutely falling assignments but still got A. Just did not like the fact I was the only female there. Making me want to vomit every time I had to speak.
rating_tags: Hilarious

comment: 100% take him for ME1001, he is in charge of the pumpkin launch and that is the most fun Iv'e ever had in a class. He is absolutely hilarious and as long as you show up to class and treat him with respect, you are getting an A. Easy A, fun class, fun professor.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Hilarious--Respected

comment: LOVED HIM. He was an amazing professor, had so much fun in his class. Your grade consists of the pumpkin launch, hw, and attendance. The launch is a group project, so choose a good group and just try to have fun. 10-15 min hw each week. If he sees your trying and working as a team you'll get an A. Great dude and easy class take him if you can.
rating_tags: Group projects--Hilarious--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Veazie is responsible for pumpkin launch which along with attendance makes up the majority of your grade. honestly as long as you do well on the pumpkin launch an show up to class you'll be fine since he is a very easy going and understanding guy who wants you and makes it very easy to pass his class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Hilarious

comment: The pumpkin launch is the most fun I've had in a class. If you simply just research and have a plan with your group, you'll succeed. Homework is a large chunk of your grade but its also easy. He even gave groups who's launchers didn't work an A on the final and launch. Veazie wants you to figure things out for yourself and work as a team.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: AVOID!He is strict on attendance, the homework is due at weird times. He doesn't actually teach he just uses online videos or things he think teaches the content. The ME 1001 class has to build a pumpkin launcer and he gives 0 guidance as to how to be able to do this. He is so hands off with the actual content but so strict when it comes to results
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Very lacking in terms of actual instruction, gives homework every week and sometimes changes the deadline with no notice via email, d2l, or in class. For all intents and purposes you will be self taught for this course. For the love of all things sacred take another professor if you can. May whatever god you pray to have mercy on your soul.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: Dog water professor
rating_tags: Test heavy

comment: This Professor uses a video from 15 years ago as his lecture where its just him underlining the book. He is without a doubt the worst professor I have taken. I have taken him 3 times for other classes I can assure you his goal is to fail all his students so he can scale them all to pass so he can do minimal teaching. Pray he retires to save people.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Took him 4 times. His teaching methods are terrible. He makes up formulas and problem-solving procedures that go against the text. He reads from slides, and absolutely refuses to solve problems in his classes, like he knows his methods are nonsense.  Bottom line, if you want to learn real and useful engineering methods stay away. KING OF AMBIGUITY

Professor Veazie has shown that he does not exhibit the knowledge necessary to teach this course. He only reads off of slides he made from the textbook nearly a decade ago. All the homework problems and test problems are from various textbooks.  He barely teaches and he has frequently answered questions wrong with confidence. He curves every grade.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: By far most fun class ever. In charge of the Pumpkin Launch
rating_tags: Group projects--Hilarious

comment: Dr. Veazie is a very funny and fairly easy going professor. Make sure you come to class and do the homework assignments each week and you will make a good grade. The Pumpkin Launch is the main focus throughout the semester so make sure to pick a good team and dedicate time outside of class to it. He has a great policy for exempting the final exam.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: Veazie was a fun professor. His class wasn't terribly difficult. The group project is about all you are going to get graded on, so make sure you have a good team. During class, I never felt bored or uninterested, because he kept it interesting and funny at the same time. I would highly recommend anyone who is going into KSU as a freshman to take it
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Hilarious

comment: He is rude to students. Does not effectively communicate. Does not teach in class. Would not recommend this professor
rating_tags: Group projects

comment: Dynamics is a tough class. Still, I recommend moving to someone else unless if you have the time and discipline to self-study. The formula sheet is unorganized and missing formulas (radial acceleration, coefficient of restitution) and lectures are not engaging (I learned easier through YouTube than his videos). Exams took a week to grade as well.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: This dude doesn't care. He has been using the same slides since Southern Poly technic became part of Kennesaw State and probably even used them before that so the information he uses is pretty dated. Try to learn as much as you can on your own and gain as much knowledge about Machine Design. His tests are fairly decent but just make sure study well

As everyone says, the professor read the PowerPoints as his "lectures", made it entirely hard to learn the course as I personally am not a self learner. His homeworks were heavily confusing and left most students wondering what we're supposed to be turning in. His tests are just like the HWs but are relatively difficult. He heavily curves the exams
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: If your looking to learn something or explore if mechanical engineering is actually for you, steer away from Veazie. He has 0 effort into instruction. He uses dated slides from SPSU (7+ yrs old), and the homework is full of broken links / dated 480p videos from early 2000s. This class is a copy and paste for him. Easy A, but a waste of time.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Like all intro to mechanical engineering classes most of the semester revolves around design and construction of a pumpkin launcher for the annual KSU pumpkin launch event. Do your easy online coursework and put forth a solid amount of effort in the launcher project and it's an easy A. Friendly and respected. Don't procrastinate.
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: The easiest class you will probably ever take. The only assignments you will have are online through a software called Mindtap (very easy) and one big group project. Attendance is 30% of your grade. Group project is a pumpkin launch so make sure you have a decent team. If you have one of the best launchers, you exempt the final.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: Hilarious. He made this class very easy and fun. I would take again for ME 1001.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Veazie carries more about being woke than intelligent. He appears to be more interested in current a fair over teaching students. Unless you want an SPSU teaching for fire years ago, do not take the fake professor Veazie. I got an a 111 on a test, but only because I studied my ass off. Do not take him, he is not a good teacher.

I don't know why theres so much negative stuff said on here about Dr. Veazie, he is a great professor. Attendance is 40% which is good because homework is really low rating. Pumpkin launch project is awesome you have 4-5 weeks to build it and make the presentation which was a great team project, be prepared to spend more than the school gives you.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: We spent the first half of the semester working on one group project. Every time we showed up to class all we were given was more instructions for our group project. We never received any instruction on the mechanical/engineering side of the project. Even the project seemed to center more around colorful design than mechanical function.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: I took Dynamics over the summer. Although I heard this course being difficult, Dr. Veasie made it very easy to understand. He cares about his students and wants them to do well. If you put in the work you should be able to do well his class.
rating_tags: Respected--Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: We had a massive group project that almost took up the whole semester. Attendance is 40% of our grade. Homework assignments are weekly and require lots of time and effort. There was a final exam but it's easy. He showed up late for all of his classes and took 15+ minutes just on attendance. His lectures were boring but he was a funny guy. I.M.S
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: If you want an easy A and not have to learn a single thing, this class is for you. He did not teach any of his classes anything and the only major thing we did was the group project (which was actually fun). However I would have rather learned something that would help me later in my career.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: He was horrible. No matter how hard I worked, the professor stated at the end of the semester "Those of you who do NOT have the accumulated points as of the first two exams to pass this class should consider focusing on your other endeavors." He's effectively telling us to give up. How horrible is that? I hate his class, he's the worst.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: One of the worst teachers I have ever had. The other two he rivals also work at Kennesaw. Clueless, rude, condescending, and very poor communicator. Accuses people of cheating when your homework looks like the solutions manual he uses to show how to do the homework that he cant do himself.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I actually have to defend this guy. For Machine Design he was alright. For the tests he goes through every step of your work to give you the most partial credit he can. Tests are heavily curved. He does know what he's talking about too. If you ask him questions he can be very knowledgeable on a variety of subjects. I would almost take him again.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: We had random textbook checks but didn't touch it for any other reason. The pumpkin launch project was a joke and all that mattered was the presentation and attendance. He showed up late for all of his classes and took 15+ minutes just on attendance. After that was one long ramble that had no importance and very boring. Horrible class and professor
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Weekly MindTap quiz and problem set, attendance is PARAMOUNT; lose 5% from final grade per lecture missed, unless you have a damn good excuse. The semester is dedicated to the annual first-year pumpkin launch extravaganza and little else; you have one month for the CDR, two weeks to build, and one week to prepare a design review and report. Funny
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Possibly the worst professor I've ever had. Doesn't know the material he is attempting to teach beyond "Use my equations". You will be required to use equations he gives and penalized HEAVILY for using other methods even though the equations he gives are questionable at best for their viability in real world applications. DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I absolutely learned nothing in his class. The test are just like the homework. If there is anything off about tests you will not get a good grade. I have learned nothing from his class and I am surprised that I even got a 'A'.  He curves his grades a lot. I would only take him again if I just wanted a grade and nothing else.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Worst professor ever! Class was easy but sitting through the class was painful. Attendance is 40% of your final grade so you know this class was some bull. Pumpkin launch project bull as well (you have about 1 1/2 weeks to build). He shows up to class LATE every class and spends at least 10-15 mins on attendance every class. Would not recommend!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: He relies very heavily on basic lectures that were also posted online. Showing up was 40% of our overall grade. The final was 100 multiple choice and true/false questions which were tricky and specific. The homework was a completion grade. I wouldn't take him unless he's your last option because he's awkward, boring, and quite rude as a person.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: When class attendance is worth 40% of your grade you know your in for some bull bull. The class did not teach anything that would be helpful in engineering. The final was on things not even spoken of in class. The only upside would be that the homework is not too bad he makes some funny jokes here and there. Beware of random book checks also.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Hilarious

comment: The worst teacher I have ever had in my entire life. At the beginning of the year you are given the study guide for the final (25% of grade) and then he moves on to the pumpkin launch project. We didnt discuss the actual material for the final until the last two weeks. He didnt teach anything about the test. Would give a negative if possible.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: This man talks SOO slow. He gave us two weeks to design and build a huge trebuchet then immediately after, we had to turn in a 15 page report and present a 15 minute PowerPoint. Would not recommend. Attendance is 40% of the grade. Be ready to be bored, and you cannot use any technology or he takes points off your final grade.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Veazie is tough. I am getting an A in my Dynamics class but only because of natural ability. He doesn't listen to problems asked and when you ask about homework questions, he only pulls up solution manuals but never explains. You have to figure out most stuff for yourself. He is tough, very tough.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: This man assigned a huge project on the first day of class but limited us to when we could start on each part of the project. He made us design and build a huge trebuchet within 3 weeks then immediately after, we had to turn in a 15 page report and present a 15 minute PowerPoint. Would not recommend.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He only reads from power points made by other professors and he doesn't even understand the course material himself. Don't take him if you actually want to learn anything
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Reads off powerpoints. Cannot do his own example/test problems without a solutions manual. However, gives 20+ point "curves" on tests.

If you want don't want to be discouraged from being a mechanical engineer then don't take this guy. So many people in my class have told me that they want to switch majors now. This is due to his teaching for we did not learn anything about mechanical engineering yet. He is a very nice guy that has some sense of humor but he is not worth taking.

Ok so this guy is amazingly ignorant at what he is teaching. All he does is read slides someone else makes getting lost as he reads them. If you ask him a question he will dance around it never actually giving you an answer. Homework is ridiculous he has no idea how to do it but will immediatley pull out the solutions manual. Honestly do not take!

This professor is a very nice person, but how about we grade him on his ability to teach?  Well there is none so that is a F.  He is very good though at reading slides that other professors have developed for the course.  He is very good at showing solution manual problem for questions, but never ask a question bc he will call you an idiot.

Worst teacher I have ever had.  Only reads slides for the entire lecture. If you ask a question, he can't answer it unless its on his slides.  Tests are very hard but he curves so people will pass.  Doesn't know the material seemingly at all.  He seems to be figuring it out with us as we go.  Insulting if you ask a question.  Avoid at all costs!!!!

Intro to ME is an absolute joke of a class. On top of that, you have to deal with Veazie. I specifically asked him questions about certain projects, he replied, and then at a later date he claimed he never said such things to me. He's also been somewhat rude to some of the students. I don't care that he as a PhD, he says some stupid sh!t.

Thinking about dropping this class. I have never dropped a class before, but this guy doesn't really teach, so much as simply go through slides. He assigns a bunch of homework which he doesn't even understand, which becomes apparent when you ask him about a problem. He will just pull up a solution manual, and never actually work the problem.

He's pretty funny, but his lectures are too long, and sometimes boring; this is especially when he explains an easy concept so much that it becomes confusing.  He always arrived 10 mins late and lectured 10 mins after class was suppose to end.

Veazie is one of the most disorganized individuals I've ever met.  To make things significantly worse, his attitude is terrible.  Ask him to work a problem on the board, he'll refuse.  Ask him to talk through a problem or theory with you, he'll treat you like an idiot and skirt the question.  Intelligent man, maybe; but he is not a good professor.

Wants you to attend lecture. But he only reads his power points, which are online and you can read by yourself. He's smart but he doesn't know how to teach. Lectures consist of student watching professor read the projector screen.

This class was a joke. He was pretty funny sometimes but that's the best thing about him.  After a while he repeated the same jokes over and over. He likes to pick on and insult students. He's lazy and disorganized. I would avoid him for any real engineering classes. I don't think he actually graded anything, the class was just a formality.

As a non-traditional student, I know that the issues listed here about Veazie will prepare you for the real world. You have to take initiative to read on your own. You have to put up with the occasional offensive comment. These are things you will have to deal with from future bosses. He knows his subject and has potential to be a decent mentor.

All year long you do a pumpkin launching project that costs you hundreds of dollars out of pocket, just to take an extremely broad final with no preparation... Other ME classes had a project that costed less than a hundred dollars easily. Only plus is that he grades easy on the HW assignments when there are some. He is ignorant though.
Have yet to learn anything. Paid for a textbook and rarely use it. Makes you do expensive and time consuming project for 2 credit hours
This class was pointless. Dr. Veazie, however was a fun teacher and seemed like he would be great for actual future engineering courses.

I took his Intro ME class and I can safely say that he is one of the most confusing teachers I've ever encountered. There was no clear subject that was supposed to be taught, and what was mentioned in class had little to no relevance to engineering. We received the warning that the class was tied into SPSU 1001, but not a continuation.

Dr Veazie is a very good professor, though I would not recommend taking any class labeled "hybrid" during the summer. The material was well explained but there is only so much you can ask with a keyboard in a multidimensional physics course. Very professional teacher and has a nice resume to match.
Doesn't understand the problems that he assigns so he can't help you.

Veazie is cool because he trys to relate and be friends with his students. He is funny too will make you laugh unlike other engineering professors he is laid back. when he comes in the room he always ask "any questions"I think if you take him ask questions
Very funny, but DO NOT txt in his class. Tests are kinda difficult

Funny guy and a great teacher. I learned a lot from this guy but you have to ask questions if you don't understand. Probably the best professor to take cause he's your friend if you try, he'll work with you.
Did not know how to solve problems he assigned, used lots of class time to try, but never could give a clear answer.

Fairly demanding when it comes to out of class work. Tests are not surprising but also not predictable. Lab work is light. Good test scoring policy. Take him but expect to do homework to get good grade.
